result.execSummary:
The defendant Julio C. Yeste was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Julio C. Yeste is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Julio C. Yeste was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Julio C. Yeste was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Ct. 1 - Dismissed.
Counseling as required.
DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julio C. Yeste

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request/Agreement For Modification to Conditions of Probation

Defendant Julio C. Yeste in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:10 a.m. Agreement stated - State has complied with VWNR, at request of victim, dismissing ct 1 w/o prejudice, Def will plead to cts 2 & 3,  withheld sentence, 1 yr pr, counseling and court costs. Atty Goetz and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to ct 2 - no contest. Plea to ct 3 - no contest. Constitutional rights, elements and penalties reviewed. Atty Goetz satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis stipulated. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of ct 2 misd battery, dom abuse, and ct 3 disorderly conduct, dom abuse. Atty Goetz advises that Def is asking for costs or portion of costs be remitted. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. On ct 2 - sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, counseling as required, court costs. Ct 3 - sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, counseling, court costs. Ct 1 dismissed w/out prejudice. Apply bond if no objection from poster by 4:30 p.m. on 11/9/15.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. DNA sample and surcharges. No credit if revoked. Postconviction rights.
No use of alcohol.   No violent contact with D. J. - Upon completed of safety plan

Defendant Julio C. Yeste in court vai video with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Julio C. Yeste in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Issue of bond, arguments presented by Atty Schuster.  Victim requesting no contact provision be lifted.  Victim to complete safety plan.  Response by State for bond.  Bond amended by court   Time limits for preliminary waived  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
